paragraphs.text: One can find multiple varieties of motor vehicles in Republic City.

paragraphs.body: Motor vehicles are a form of ${link_0} available in all ${link_1}. Following the end of the ${link_2}, the ${link_3} advanced to a stage where the mass production of these modes of transportation became possible.
paragraphs.text: Motor vehicles are a form of transportation available in all four nations. Following the end of the Hundred Year War, the World of Avatar advanced to a stage where the mass production of these modes of transportation became possible.

paragraphs.body: While many forms of motor vehicles were used during the Hundred Year War, proper combustion-powered automobiles were introduced into ${link_0} sometime between 128 ${link_1} and 140 AG. Initially, they possessed much cruder designs, resembling more traditional "horseless carriages" as well as having solid tires. By 171 AG, technological advancements resulted in motor vehicles having more varied, sophisticated, ornate designs.
paragraphs.text: While many forms of motor vehicles were used during the Hundred Year War, proper combustion-powered automobiles were introduced into Republic City sometime between 128 AG and 140 AG. Initially, they possessed much cruder designs, resembling more traditional "horseless carriages" as well as having solid tires. By 171 AG, technological advancements resulted in motor vehicles having more varied, sophisticated, ornate designs.

paragraphs.text: Future Industries tests its Satomobiles, such as these race cars, on a test course.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} are cars produced by ${link_1}. ${link_2} created the brand after convincing a wealthy banker to invest in the production of automobiles for the common citizen, and his daughter, ${link_3}, later took over as head of the company. The Satomobile popularized the use of gasoline-powered engines, which eventually took prevalence over steam engines due to its practicality in small-scale use.
paragraphs.text: Satomobiles are cars produced by Future Industries. Hiroshi Sato created the brand after convincing a wealthy banker to invest in the production of automobiles for the common citizen, and his daughter, Asami, later took over as head of the company. The Satomobile popularized the use of gasoline-powered engines, which eventually took prevalence over steam engines due to its practicality in small-scale use.

paragraphs.body: Eager to cash in on the success of Sato's gasoline engine, several other companies began manufacturing automobiles as well. One of these was Cabbage Corp, which soon began marketing the Cabbage Car, a cheap, compact alternative to the Satomobile.
paragraphs.text: Eager to cash in on the success of Sato's gasoline engine, several other companies began manufacturing automobiles as well. One of these was Cabbage Corp, which soon began marketing the Cabbage Car, a cheap, compact alternative to the Satomobile.
